result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony B. Pegg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with the victim.
----------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------

Pay court costs.   Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------

Pay Sheriff fees in the amount of $80.00.
---------------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete (40) forty hours of community service EACH year of probation to a total of (80) eighty hours of community service work during his period of probation WITH NO BUYOUT.

supervisions.notes: with work release privileges. 4.5 months stayed pending review hearing on April 11, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.
To participate in AA, Celebrate Recovery and domestic abuse counseling at the Jail with status reports on all three programs to be provided at review hearing.

CONCURRENT to count #3 and with work release privileges. 4.5 months stayed pending review hearing on April 11, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.
Concurrent with: Count #3

11:30 am  Defendant Anthony B. Pegg in court with attorney Daniel Joseph Mei.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Mei provides documentation of what steps defendant has taken to complete counseling and treatment needs.  
Court finds defendant is in compliance and will continue stay without further review.
Minutes filed.
Temporary Commitment form filed

2:36 pm  Defendant Anthony B. Pegg in court in custody with attorney Daniel Joseph Mei. Prosecuting Atty Matthew R. Leusink appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Agent Nicole Hewitt, DOC, in court.
Both sides have reviewed revocation packet.  State is in compliance with victim's rights.
2:42 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Leusink.
2:50 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Mei.
2:54 pm  Defendant makes statement to Court.
2:56 pm  Attorney Mei continues with sentencing argument.
2:58 pm  Defendant reads a prepared written statement.
3:04 pm  Final argument by Attorney Mei.
3:06 pm  Agent Hewitt addresses Court.
3:08 pm  Court hears from victim, T.M.P.
3:12 pm  Court will impose 9 months Jail with work release on each count, concurrent to each other.  4.5 months stayed pending review hearing on April 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.  
Defendant will be entitled to 63 days dead time credit, if confirmed by Jail records.  
3:18 pm  Court in recess.  Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-02-2016 02:30 pm.

*AMENDMENT 2-12-2015 - NO CONTACT WITH T.M.P. OR HER RESIDENCE MODIFIED TO NO VIOLENT CONTACT.   "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15GF122 (15-503, 15-504, 15-505, 15-506, 15-507) AND 15GF125 (15-521)
MUST POST $500.00 CASH. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.M.P. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
See Signature bond set 2-10-2015
